definition.name: RegEx Issue Labeler
definition.description: Labels issues automatically based on their body
definition.author: GitHub

inputs.name: configuration-path
inputs.description: The path to the label configuration file. If the file doesn't exist at the specified path on the runner, action will read from the source repository via the Github API.

inputs.name: enable-versioned-regex
inputs.description: Controls if versioned regex templates are being used

inputs.name: versioned-regex
inputs.description: The regex version number to use. Only required if using versioned regex files

inputs.name: not-before
inputs.description: Is optional and will result in any issues prior to this timestamp to be ignored

inputs.name: body-missing-regex-label
inputs.description: The name of the label that should be added to an issue where the specified `version-regex` can not be found.

inputs.name: include-title
inputs.description: Include the title in the regex target

inputs.name: include-body
inputs.description: Include the body in the regex target

inputs.name: sync-labels
inputs.description: Remove the label from the issue if the label regex does not match

inputs.name: issue-number
inputs.description: The number of the issue/PR to label

outputs.name: labels-added
outputs.description: The labels that were added by the action, as a stringified array.

outputs.name: labels-removed
outputs.description: The labels that were removed by the action, as a stringified array.

evidence.reasoning: The action automatically labels issues based on their content, facilitating communication within the team and improving code quality by organizing issues effectively.
